column4: hey yeall, last night i started the software update in the task tray, it downloaded the newest headers i think, well when i rebooted xserver crashed. I am also usind the nvidia drivers from their website
you probably got a new kernel.. you'll have to install the nvidia drivers again
you don't have to mess with the xorg.conf file.. just run that nvidia file ... "sudo sh NVIDIAblabla.sh"
it's still there, at nvidias site... same place...you need an url?
you can use wget  "sudo apt-get install wget"
thanks, where will it put it then?
it will download to your current directory.. usually your home dir
that's an ok place for it to be
at the moment they are the same, I think
i triet that wget command and it said it could not resolve the host i think the url is right i just dont think my internet connection was working
hmm.. the urls was right, yes.. something else might be wrong
can you ping www.nvidia.com or some similar address?
but you had network connection before the kernel upgrade.. right?
do you use a wireless connection? something else that only runs under gnome?
and the ip is correct? can you ping something else? www.sunet.se? some other known address that is close to you?
